page.title: 18LICHFIELD CANALS
page.content: There is a small Marina on the Coventry canal at Streethay, developed from what was once a maltings.Part of the area was once a coal yard.The coal was carried in barges pulled by horses. The Marina today is run by a man and his wife.They do small repairs and some repainting.The wife paints the decorations on the "narrowboats" in the traditional style of roses and castles. The average number of "narrowboats" and motor cruisers moored at the Marina is about 15 on any one day. The Lichfield canal Cruising Club has a clubhouse by the canal at Huddlesford and a total of sixty-five motor cruisers and "narrowboats" with diesel engines.
